greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sum of divisors of n that are not perfect powers.
comment: Sequence is not the same as A183098(n): a(72) = 137, A183098(72) = 65.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16385
Index entries for sequences related to sums of divisors
formula: a(1) = 0, a(p) = p, a(pq) = p+q+pq, a(pq...z) = [(p+1)*(q+1)*…*(z+1)]-1, a(p^k) = p, for p, q = primes, k = natural numbers, pq...z = product of k (k > 2) distinct primes p, q, ..., z.
example: For n = 12, set of such divisors is {2, 3, 6, 12}; a(12) = 2+3+6+12=23.
maple: N:= 1000: # to get a(1) to a(N)
seq(convert(numtheory:-divisors(t) minus S,`+`), t=1..N); # _Robert Israel_, Oct 02 2014
program: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, d*((d!=1) && !ispower(d))); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 02 2014
results.author: _Jaroslav Krizek_, Dec 25 2010
